alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Hamilton; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 8:19PM CDT until June 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... York County in east central Nebraska... Southeastern Hamilton County in south central Nebraska... Northern Fillmore County in south central Nebraska... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 818 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bradshaw, or 9 miles west of York, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 812 PM CDT...emergency management reported golf ball size hail 1 mile north of Hampton. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Lushton around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include McCool Junction, Fairmont and Exeter. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 332 and 365. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant property damage. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
